data.title: Will Arnett says his divorce from Amy Poehler was ‚Äúalmost excruciating‚Ä¶Just brutal, brutal, brutal."
data.meta_description: Will Arnett says his divorce from Amy Poehler was ‚Äúalmost excruciating‚Ä¶Just brutal, brutal, brutal. https://t.co/tod3xJ2cvz  VANITY FAIR (@VanityFair) February 9, 2022 source In an interview with The Guardian Arnett opened up about how hard the divorce in 2012 was [It was] ‚Äúalmost‚Ä¶
data.text:
Glad he pulled over cause my ass has sobbed over a breakup while driving on the freeway and it‚Äôs not safe tbh!

Pls don't Euphoria your life, bb. Stay safe ‚ô•Ô∏è

Thanks bb. I didn‚Äôt get out the car and make a run for it like Miss Rue Rue but sometimes when ‚ÄúIf You‚Äôre Not the One‚Äù by Daniel Bedingfeld pops up on your shuffle right after your bf dumped you and moved away you just gotta cry it out!

Yes,it was smart of him.

I teared up twice over my senior dog while driving home. It was not a good idea, once was to take him to the vet, and the other once was to go and collect his ash.

My father got a ticket because he passed a red light or a stop sign the week my mom told him she would get a divorce. He still brought it up once awhile and blamed her over the ticket for years.

The way ONTD collectively sobbed over this divorce announcement is forever etched in my memory

I would like to be excluded from this narrative as I don't care about either one of them

The only thing I remember is that the divorce was a blind item and people here guessed it but they were hoping it was the usual bs.

Lmao I always think about that whenever I see news about either of them.

yo i just went back to that post and it was 1400 comments!!!! has that ever happened again since?

John Mulaney cheating posts lol

How they treated Jessica really soured me on the whole show, which I used to love. The cast always seemed to have a bit of a dickish vibe (it always seemed Portia was kept a bit on the outside too) but that was not cool.

god that fucking INFURIATED me

they've been able to keep it classy since they split up, right? don't recall hearing about any messiness (in regards to their divorce/co-parenting)

Amy refused to talk about it in her book. She didn‚Äôt just ignore it she flat said she wasn‚Äôt going to say anything about it.

Good for her, that‚Äôs the classy thing to do for your kids

‚ÄúPeople talk about you like they know you and they talk about your relationship as if they know what‚Äôs going on. So imagine how weird that is. It‚Äôs brutal with any relationship, and we have kids, and without getting into specifics, you then see stuff online, like, this one journalist wrote: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm Team Amy.‚Äô I‚Äôm like: ‚ÄòYou‚Äôre a grown person. What are you talking about? This is a breakup. This is a family. This isn‚Äôt some game.‚Äô‚Äù

I see this a lot in the Olivia Munn/that dude who knocked her up/his wife posts and I completely agree with this.

The way people talk about their relationship is so weird to me. Like none of you guys have any idea what actually happened for them to break up. All you see is what they post on IG. John and Olivia seem very happy together.

I always file that under weird white people news.

(no subject) - topismine Expand

Indeed! My guess is that she initiated the split.

there were rumors he cheated but idk. supposedly the character of Heather Graham on his Netflix show was based after Amy and my guess is Amy's career took off and she became known for smart humor whereas he kind of became known for being stupid/having dumb roles. He got pretty snappy at some comments on instagram about the stuff he was doing (it was a really bad movie about a dog show that flopped) so I wouldn't be surprised if there were deeper issues there.

in amy's memoir she has a whole chapter called "my books on divorce" where she says she doesn't want to talk about it because it's "too sad" and "too personal", and instead pitches some titles for books about divorce that would be more realistic with the advice people need/give. she also says she's happy will is the father of her kids and that she's proud they're able to take care of their kids.

i remember they even quarantined together during the beginning of the pandemic too

Quarantining together for the kids is a really awesome thing to do, I'm glad they could do it.

I can't believe it's been almost 10yr. How?

Right? I remember the ONTD post about it like it was yesterday‚Ä¶.üò¶

This is my 2nd ever lj and I got a message that it was my 18tj birthday and I've definitely been here most of that time. How!? lmao

He's one of my favorite Batmen of all time üò¨üòÑ

I've thought about what it'd be like to be going through a really hard time and have thousands of strangers commenting on my social media posts about how horrible I am and all the things I did wrong when they know nothing and... idk what'd happen to me. I know to take the internet with a grain of salt but being pelted so consistently with that kind of diatribe would really hurt my mental health.

A few times when I was younger I thought about doing stuff on YouTube and even a few years ago was mulling over a podcast but never got to it and as time rolls on I definitely feel like that laziness ended up benefitting me because I already have an issue with hyper focusing on my flaws by myself, I certainly wouldn't need any outside input LOL

It‚Äôs been almost 10 years

Damn I couldn't believe this but looked it up and they did separate in 2012 (tho didn't officially divorce until 2016) - i can't believe it's been that long

"People talk about you like they know you and they talk about your relationship as if they know what‚Äôs going on. So imagine how weird that is. It‚Äôs brutal with any relationship, and we have kids, and without getting into specifics, you then see stuff online, like, this one journalist wrote: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm Team Amy.‚Äô I‚Äôm like: ‚ÄòYou‚Äôre a grown person. What are you talking about? This is a breakup. This is a family. This isn‚Äôt some game.‚Äô‚Äù

Not this firmly snatching ONTD's wig! LOL

That's definitely something we do a lot - speculate, assign blame, judge - and I do think in general the way we here especially at times have those types of parasocial relationships with our fave celebs could be examined a bit within ourselves. Like it's one thing to judge someone for being actually harmful (abusive, racist, homophobic, sexist) but I've definitely been trying to not assume so-so much myself because ultimately we don't know the whole truth most of the time/in most circumstances. At the same time I do feel glad at the community we have here because we remember important things that are awful that celebs have done and don't just easily brush those aside or pretend they don't matter. We have those nuanced discussions I really can appreciate and get no where else.

(no subject) - (Anonymous)

it's the whole search for a perfect god thing and i legit fear for the next generation if we don't get a handle on it. expecting anyone to be perfect, while professing your perfection is a road to ruin. since social media is used as such a judgement ground you see people looking for bad faith in everything and there are legit sociology studies that talk about how if you're always looking for bad faith, you will see it. let alone the discussions on how in real life something is in the past, that's how time has always worked, and being a dumb ass teenager is an actual life thing, but online something years ago can be made current in the blink of a retweet. that alone will screw with one's mental processing since usually it's just family that never lets shit go. oh just mine? /s

Let alone the studies talking about how much the idea of mistakes, forgiveness, actually moving on, atoning, and grace are taking a hit in doing in people's mental health cause nobody is perfect, we've all misspoken, changed a view, etc etc. That colliding with the parasocial relationship stuff, the whole holding celebs to a bigger standard than politicians and actual power people, it's all making for a big recipe for disaster.

I'm endlessly fascinated by the paradoxes that exist online and how much most of us discounted the reach and negatives of social media, i think to our detriment, because we personally felt we had a handle on it and our reactions. all while not fully appreciating the magnitude of the reach and how many can't handle the information waves coming at them. and i don't think it's always a them problem.

(no subject) - pikapika217 Expand

I really dislike when people say "team xxxx" when people are getting divorced, because unless that person is a known shitbag you don't know what is going on. If I learned anything as I got older relationships and marriages end because both sides suck (with the exception of abusive people) at something and it unravels everything.

Example: My mother is unbearable on lots of things, my father hasn't matured past 17 and spends money that isn't there. They both sucked and it was both their faults they got divorced.

It must suck but I guess celebs must be used to people having unfounded opinions about their lives.

Didn‚Äôt he cheat on her??
